name: TownePlace Suites Fort Worth Bedford

reviews.text: We stayed here a few years ago and I didn't leave a very flattering review. This time, our experience was much better.
reviews.title: Clean budget hotel with free wifi and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facility is well-maintained. You can practically see Hwy 183 from the parking lot, so it has easy access to the freeway (if you ignore the temporary construction). There is free breakfast and free wifi. The wifi was very reliable throughout our stay. The breakfast was good, you can make waffles, eat some of the limited selection on warmers, or microwave some of the pre-packaged items in the refrigerator.
reviews.title: Great Marriott Property! Will stay again!

reviews.text: We had no issues sleeping. The front desk worked with me when I requested a late checkout.
reviews.title: The good, bad and bizarre

reviews.text: We would consider staying here again when shopping for budget accomodations.
reviews.title: Seemed New, and Very clean
Average Stay for the price
reviews.text: This hotel was very clean and the one bedroom allowed us the room we needed. The staff was exceptionally friendly. Tom on the overnight shift was amazing!! He made sure we had everything we needed. We experienced some sugar ants during our stay and your staff sprayed our room while we were out and they were gone. Wonderful response and service! The bed was very soft but did the job. This is definitely a hotel I will be staying in again and again!

There was not one person at this hotel that did not try their best to make my two day stay perfect. I needed several copies and Jaymes, the front desk clerk insisted he be the one to help me and that I need not to venture out at night to find a copier. And as for Ms. Monica Coy, assistant GM, she did everything she could to accomodate my late departure even though she had a FULL HOUSE that day. These people made a difference and for that reason, I am thankful.Even the maintenance people greeted me with a smile in the hall. I needed those smiles. It was a stressful two days of work. Thank you TownePlace Suite staff.
reviews.title: The STAFF Makes the STAY

reviews.text: I stayed at this property in November 2012 and came back at the end of January 2013 because I had such a good experience. Something definitely changed in the meantime.
reviews.title: Okay, but Losing Luster
Average is about right
reviews.text: I couldn't get the same room as before since there was a group in-house where that room had already been assigned, which was disappointing, but understandable.

reviews.title: Lower than a "no tell-motel"
reviews.text: However, there were things that didn't go right, well, or just plain went badly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the place is falling into disrepair. The stairwell rails are in dire need of being sanded down and re-painted. It's clear that they've been touched up repeatedly, but they need re-done completely.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We had a bad start with the service agent. He did not give us any of the 3 discounts that we normally get from the Marriott properties and said it was because we went through a "3rd" party service. The room smelled like a wet dog and I was given a can of Febreeze. The smell never went away and we continually had to open the one window that worked every time we entered the room to air the room out. Breakfast typically for a different chain of hotels, but not this chain as we are customed to. We had maid service to our room in the middle of the week and the linen was not changed. That was a new one on me as the Marriott used to be a clean environment. Hot tub??? There were roaches crawling around the area and after I let out a loud scream that would wake the hotel members, the manager never stepped out to see what was going on. The rest of the stay I was terrified of the roaches and afraid they would get into my car. We will not be back and question how the Marriott chain of hotels acquired this property.
reviews.title: "You get what you pay for"
A GREAT choice in North Dallas / Ft. Worth
reviews.text: I stayed here for about 2 weeks and wish we could have stayed longer. They were wrapping up a remodel, but it didn't interfere with our stay and we got to enjoy beautiful, newly updated rooms!

I stayed in a studio and the decor is all modern including stainless steel appliances and new linens, etc... the bathroom was not large, but everything worked well and the housekeeping was amazing so each day it felt like I came back to a brand new place. The rooms themselves are quiet and because this isn't a huge hotel, you don't have tons of people moving around outside in the halls.
reviews.title: Ho hum

reviews.text: The lobby is small and the continental breakfast is pretty lean, but they did have yogurt, microwaveable breakfast sandwiches, cereal, fruit, coffee, and some pastries. With a kitchenette, it was easy to fix something myself if need be. The outdoor area is pretty small and so is the parking lot, but there is a huge parking lot right in front that you can use (belongs to a 24 Hour Fitness, but this area is not used by the gym). The wifi was strong and I had no problems with it during my stay.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Value!

reviews.text: The staff was super friendly and Jason (the afternoon person) was great at remembering names, making sure there was coffee all day and fresh baked cookies in the evening.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret in this Area!

reviews.text: The hotel was quiet, clean and comfortable, maybe because it's a 3 story building. We always enjoy the room kitchenette amenities the TownePlace Suites provides as well as free WiFi connection. The location and parking felt safe and comfortable. There were nearby restaurants for afternoon dinning. The free continental breakfast is a plus, but it's not a hot breakfast as you could get at other hotels...breakfast includes (waffles, bagels, cereal, hard boiled eggs served cold, microwave sausage biscuits, etc) but could be better. Our stay was during a holiday weekend, so during breakfast, seating was very limited, but we managed to get a table. The room size is descent but our bed was not as comfortable as we imagine it could have been. During our 3-night stay, we had some sleepless nights. We have been Marriott members for several years now and have stayed at numerous hotels, but this particular hotels bed was not as comfortable as the ones at other locations.
reviews.title: Comfortable and reasonable value
Clean, relaxing and new
reviews.text: We did have one issue with this hotel. The hotel manager did email me earlier stating they had a question on my reservation. I did not read my message a few days earlier, but when I called, both the manager and assistant manager were out. The email did not state there was not an issue with my reservation, so I assumed nothing was wrong. Upon check-in, I was told I was reserved for two rooms being they did not a have my 2 double bedroom as I had reserved. I had made a reservation for a 2 queen bedroom for my husband and 5 year old son. There was no need for an additional room for the 3 of us so I declined the additional one. My 5 year old normally gets his own bed, so he had to sleep on the sofa bed. Not a big issue, but being that it was an uncomfortable sofa bed, as most of them are, he managed to have restful nights. I'm sure I paid for a 2 bedroom price for the 1 bedroom room we received, no big deal, but the hotel should of at least stated in full details there was an issue with my reservation in the email. I was caught by surprise, but other than that, it was quite a pleasant stay and I would recommend this hotel for on the go occupants or small families.

This was a spacious, home type location. I enjoyed the rooms and the extras in the kitchenette. While breakfast felt more commercial, the food was still good. I appreciated the clean bathrooms and the availability of the fitness room. I would stay again if in the area.
reviews.title: Just average for a long stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 weeks during a work. The "grab and go" breakfast is not much at all. I've stayed at Staybridge Suites and they have an awesome fresh, hot breakfast. The place is a bit dated but my room was clean. There is only one air conditioner for the suite. It was VERY cold in the living area and if turned to a warmer setting, the bedroom got very stuffy and warm. They do have a pull-out sofa but not sure how sleeping next to the ice cold air conditioner would feel. There are a few other kitchenette hotels in this area. I would recommend one of those compared to this one. Staff is friendly and the hotel is close to the freeway, restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: comfortable & good value

reviews.text: We enjoyed two nights here and it is nice to have more than one room which is typical of most hotels. ONe room with a living area adjacent to the full kitchen was good size, clean and comfortable. The bedroom was just that with a good bed. The decor was a little dated and as we learned this property was one of the first TownePlace Suites in the Marriott portfolio. Overall it was fine. Breakfast showed a good variety. This hotel is really good for extended stays as was most of the people staying here were families during a transition.
reviews.title: Good Value and Accommodation

aka: Towneplace Suites Fort Worth Bedford Hotel Bedford
description: TownePlace Suites in Bedford is your home away from home. Only 12 miles from the Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport. Bedford is centrally located between Dallas and Fort Worth. Within minutes you can be at The American Airline Center, Six Flags, Grapevine Mills Mall, NorthEast Mall, Lone Star Park, Ameriquest Field, and the Cowboys Stadium. Whether traveling on business or pleasure, the TownePlace Suites is close to anywhere you want to be in the D/FW Metroplex.
